]]> By: Jen http://workitmom.com/bloggers/orderingdisorder/2008/02/21/in-the-crockpot-chicken-curry-with-sweet-potatoes-and-coconut-rice/#comment-2653 Jen Mon, 02 Aug 2010 17:24:13 +0000 http://workitmom.com/bloggers/orderingdisorder/2008/02/21/in-the-crockpot-chicken-curry-with-sweet-potatoes-and-coconut-rice/#comment-2653 This was great. I only used a pound of chicken and 1 sweet potato since it was just for my husband and I, although I did use about a cup of orange juice -- I loved the citrusy zing it added. I also used garam masala, an Indian spice blend, instead of regular yellow curry powder, which I think gave it a wonderful depth of flavor. Will definitely be making this again and will experiment with different kinds of meats and veggies to add to it. Thanks for the recipe! This was great. I only used a pound of chicken and 1 sweet potato since it was just for my husband and I, although I did use about a cup of orange juice — I loved the citrusy zing it added. I also used garam masala, an Indian spice blend, instead of regular yellow curry powder, which I think gave it a wonderful depth of flavor. Will definitely be making this again and will experiment with different kinds of meats and veggies to add to it. Thanks for the recipe!

]]> By: Super_E http://workitmom.com/bloggers/orderingdisorder/2008/02/21/in-the-crockpot-chicken-curry-with-sweet-potatoes-and-coconut-rice/#comment-2448 Super_E Tue, 27 Oct 2009 22:07:08 +0000 http://workitmom.com/bloggers/orderingdisorder/2008/02/21/in-the-crockpot-chicken-curry-with-sweet-potatoes-and-coconut-rice/#comment-2448 I asked my boyfriend to make this. The directions and pictures made it look easy. My boyfriend isn't big on cooking, but I thought he could handle it. First off, he loves onions, so he used three. He wasn't sure what a clove of garlic was, he actually thought it was a head. He was going to add the entire head of garlic, but then got tired after chopping three cloves and stopped there (thank you Lord). He also doesn't like chopping things, but loves using fancy gadgets. So he used the MANdoline to slice the onions and sweet potatoes into thin slivers. I came home and the house smelled wonderful. I stirred the crockpot and noticed that it was starting to stick, so I added lots of chicken broth to it. By the time it was finished cooking, the broth wasn't fully absorbed, but that's ok. The bottom line ... if you play around with this recipe, it'll still taste FANTASTIC! Thank you for a wonderful recipe. I asked my boyfriend to make this. The directions and pictures made it look easy. My boyfriend isn’t big on cooking, but I thought he could handle it.

First off, he loves onions, so he used three. He wasn’t sure what a clove of garlic was, he actually thought it was a head. He was going to add the entire head of garlic, but then got tired after chopping three cloves and stopped there (thank you Lord).
He also doesn’t like chopping things, but loves using fancy gadgets. So he used the MANdoline to slice the onions and sweet potatoes into thin slivers.

I came home and the house smelled wonderful. I stirred the crockpot and noticed that it was starting to stick, so I added lots of chicken broth to it. By the time it was finished cooking, the broth wasn’t fully absorbed, but that’s ok.

The bottom line … if you play around with this recipe, it’ll still taste FANTASTIC!

Thank you for a wonderful recipe.
